Title: [GPS Manager][Navigation]Verify that User can navigate to Dashboard successfully
Description: Navigate to Dashboard landing page to access GPS Manager functionality
Steps: 1. Open website https://staging.app.exampleplatform.com/dashboard; 2. Wait for page loading indicators; 3. Verify dashboard header appears; 4. Check navigation menu visibility; 5. Confirm main content area loads; 6. Verify sidebar elements display; 7. Validate all dashboard components are accessible
Expected Result: 1. Browser navigates to dashboard URL successfully; 2. Loading indicators appear and complete; 3. Dashboard header displays with correct title; 4. Navigation menu items are visible and clickable; 5. Main content area shows dashboard widgets; 6. Sidebar navigation elements are properly displayed; 7. All dashboard components are fully loaded and interactive

Title: [GPS Manager][Module Access]Verify that User can access GPS Data Analytics module successfully
Description: Open GPS Data Analytics module from top menu bar
Steps: 1. Locate Gps Data Analytics in top menu bar; 2. Click on Gps Data Analytics menu item; 3. Wait for module loading animation; 4. Verify GPS Analytics page loads; 5. Check page title and header; 6. Confirm navigation elements appear; 7. Validate all GPS Analytics components are accessible
Expected Result: 1. Gps Data Analytics menu item is visible and highlighted; 2. Menu item click triggers navigation action; 3. Loading animation appears during transition; 4. GPS Analytics page loads completely; 5. Page displays correct title and header information; 6. Navigation elements for GPS Analytics are visible; 7. All GPS Analytics dashboard components are fully functional

Title: [GPS Manager][Date Filter]Verify that User can filter playback by date range successfully
Description: Filter playback by selecting specific date range
Steps: 1. Locate date range selector control; 2. Click on date range input field; 3. Enter start date 2025-05-14 00:58:29; 4. Enter end date 2025-05-15 12:27:53; 5. Click apply or confirm button; 6. Wait for data filtering process; 7. Verify filtered results display
Expected Result: 1. Date range selector is visible and accessible; 2. Date input field accepts user input; 3. Start date is entered and validated correctly; 4. End date is entered and validated correctly; 5. Apply action triggers filtering process; 6. Loading indicator shows data is being filtered; 7. Data reloads showing only selected time period results

Title: [GPS Manager][Vehicle Search]Verify that User can search vehicle by number successfully
Description: Search vehicle by entering specific vehicle number
Precondition: Selected vehicle must have GPS data in selected time range to update map
Steps: 1. Locate Search vehicle number field; 2. Click on search input field; 3. Enter vehicle number 1616; 4. Press enter or click search button; 5. Wait for search processing; 6. Verify search results appear; 7. Confirm vehicle data loads on timeline
Expected Result: 1. Search vehicle number field is visible and accessible; 2. Input field becomes active and ready for typing; 3. Vehicle number 1616 is entered correctly; 4. Search action is triggered successfully; 5. Search processing indicator appears; 6. Search results display vehicle 1616 information; 7. Vehicle 1616 data is loaded and visible on timeline

Title: [GPS Manager][Vehicle Selection]Verify that User can select checkbox to trigger map data successfully
Description: Select checkbox to activate vehicle data on map
Steps: 1. Locate checkbox next to searched vehicle 1616; 2. Click on the vehicle checkbox; 3. Observe immediate visual feedback; 4. Wait for map loading animation; 5. Verify map updates with vehicle data; 6. Check timeline activation; 7. Confirm vehicle path appears on map
Expected Result: 1. Checkbox is visible next to vehicle 1616 entry; 2. Checkbox changes state when clicked; 3. Visual feedback shows selection is active; 4. Loading animation appears on map area; 5. Map displays vehicle data and location markers; 6. Timeline becomes active with vehicle information; 7. Vehicle path is rendered and visible on map

Title: [GPS Manager][Playback Controls]Verify that User can use playback speed controls successfully
Description: Use playback speed controls to manage animation
Steps: 1. Locate playback control panel; 2. Click on pause button; 3. Verify animation pauses; 4. Click on 1x speed button; 5. Click on 8x speed button; 6. Observe speed change effects; 7. Verify animation updates accordingly
Expected Result: 1. Playback control panel is visible and accessible; 2. Pause button click stops animation immediately; 3. Animation pauses and timeline stops moving; 4. 1x speed button activates normal playback speed; 5. 8x speed button activates fast playback speed; 6. Speed changes are visually apparent in animation; 7. Map animation updates with selected speed settings

Title: [GPS Manager][Toggle Functions]Verify that User can toggle unplanned stop visibility successfully
Description: Toggle unplanned stop visibility on map
Precondition: Vehicle path must be loaded on map
Steps: 1. Locate Unplanned Stops toggle switch; 2. Check current toggle state; 3. Click on toggle switch; 4. Observe toggle state change; 5. Wait for map update processing; 6. Verify unplanned stops visibility change; 7. Confirm map displays updated information
Expected Result: 1. Unplanned Stops toggle switch is visible and accessible; 2. Current toggle state is clearly indicated; 3. Toggle switch responds to click action; 4. Toggle state changes from off to on or vice versa; 5. Map processing indicator shows update in progress; 6. Unplanned stops become visible or hidden on map; 7. Map displays updated unplanned stop information correctly

Title: [GPS Manager][Animation Playback]Verify that User can play GPS animation successfully
Description: Play GPS animation using play button
Precondition: Vehicle data must be visible on timeline
Steps: 1. Locate play_arrow button in controls; 2. Click on play_arrow button; 3. Observe playback initialization; 4. Monitor vehicle icon movement; 5. Check timeline progression; 6. Verify route animation display; 7. Confirm continuous playback operation
Expected Result: 1. Play_arrow button is visible and accessible; 2. Button click triggers playback start action; 3. Playback initialization begins immediately; 4. Vehicle icon starts moving along route path; 5. Timeline progresses showing current position; 6. Route animation is smooth and visible; 7. Playback continues automatically until completion or pause

Title: [GPS Manager][Keyboard Navigation]Verify that User can use keyboard navigation to move playback successfully
Description: Use keyboard navigation to control playback timeline
Precondition: Vehicle timeline must be active and loaded
Steps: 1. Focus on playback timeline control; 2. Press right arrow key; 3. Observe timeline position change; 4. Press left arrow key; 5. Verify timeline moves backward; 6. Check vehicle position updates; 7. Confirm map reflects timeline changes
Expected Result: 1. Timeline control receives keyboard focus; 2. Right arrow key advances timeline position; 3. Timeline marker moves forward appropriately; 4. Left arrow key moves timeline backward; 5. Timeline marker moves backward correctly; 6. Vehicle position updates based on timeline position; 7. Map display reflects current timeline position accurately
